review_blob:
Deep, dull dark brown color. A thin Beige Necklace very creamy, high and constant. Well carbonated with lace adhering the walls of glass along the tasting.

The aroma is warm with soft notes of coffee with medium roast, a pleasant sensation of chocolate with an intense, striking and delicious banana with toffee as well, of dark fruits like plums, raisins, a fig is present, wheat and nuances a light and spicy yeast emerges grounded in nutmeg, licorice and cloves. A delicious fresh pasta candied fruit bread that in Brazil we call panettone.

Taste is a little of what is sweet note in the aroma. The typical spicy sensation licorice Weizenbock a banana syrup is present. It also shows in its taste a light coffee with a touch of caramel and beautiful and intense bananas contained in this and wheat. Very fruity flavor. Accompanying these is present the very fine dark chocolate with spicy notes of clove, nutmeg and again the delicious fresh pasta candied fruit bread highlighting the raisins and prunes. All these flavors are grounded by a beautiful Malte Torrado in the finish and maybe a slight smoked.

Medium to full body in a low carbonation suitable for weiss style with a slightly creamy texture and balanced sweet sorrow. Its effervescence felt in the mouth is a little more noticeable.
The Aftertaste is of medium length and slightly malty with bananas and hardly notice the bitterness. It is clear the total absence in the flavor of hops.

A Refreshing Weiss with a hint of acidity in a very slight tendency Porter. A balanced and good drinkability together.
An excellent beer!
beer_name: Schneider Weisse Tap X Meine Porter Weisse

The bottle of Delirium is a unique invitation to taste this famous beer. An art that refers bottles of ancient monasteries.
This Belgian Strong Ale has a golden color slightly orange, translucent. Holds a White foam, high, consistent and average persistence. It is noted for its excellent and regular carbonation that ensures splendid and stable foam. I repeat that this is one of the few beers that I still have a growing assessment because it is a classic Belgian beer I ever drink more than four years and always surprised with their crops.
The malt aroma is light, with a little yeast and powerful Floral Fragrance. Very fruity and a stronger footprint of citrus fruits like orange and lemon, and how not, a delicious freshness of pineapple. The apricot is the faintest honey tone, and striking cinnamon, perceived by me, give an appreciable sweetness and a certain acidity aroma. One can not help but notice then, clearly, this very gentle acidity and an almost metallic aroma with a subtle smell of gum merge with the nice touch of alcohol and hot spices in this show of complexity. Very interesting and exciting this beer.
Taste is remarkably full-bodied and complex. I can say that we know we are drinking a Delirium Tremens. Points in flavor citric fruity and caramel malts, and in the end there is a coming bitterness of hops. Then mouthfeel is moderate and has an average carbonation which is larger than most style beers.
Alcohol is smooth but which together with spices provide a delicious burning and heating the tongue and the palate. It seems as if this alcoholic beer was literally light up in your mouth. Strong, durable and with a dry bitterness.
One of my favorite Belgian beers.

In the aftertaste can feel hints of almonds and a strong footprint and hot alcohol.
Really tastes and sensations of this beer are unique. Fine treatment for this beautiful drink!

Into the bowl had an orange liquid, very cloudy and yeast sediment. White cream of exceptional training, dense, tall and good duration as mandated the Tripel style. Trained ties marking the wall of glass.
A pleasantly fruity aroma (clove and banana), strong and fresh. Brings with praise citric with mild bitterness, green grapes, ripe orange, some pine touch, mingled with floral notes with beautiful doses of herbs. A foundation is clearly present the trademark of sweet honey malt expected the Tripel. Impresses the aroma.
In citric flavor and fruity notes, damask, are sweeping the mouth overshadowing a bit sweet malt notes which emerges a powerful bitterness that is characteristic of American IPAs and that somehow does not presuppose the Abbey beers Belgians, however is certain duality does not leave us to take another notion of this peculiar Tripel high lupalagem and certain acidity. This intense bitterness is very well inserted and does not stand in the set which again the intrigue by brewmaster of magic that leaves the Tripel style get lost.
The ending is very bitter and rather dry, not taking too long denoting balance. For me this drink can have a single bottle the best of both styles: Tripel and IPA.
Alcohol is almost imperceptible in taste, but do not be fooled because the dragon is there! So the ABV 9% comes as a big surprise for such a refreshing drink.
Can be, despite the alcohol content, be much more balanced in terms of freshness verses depth of flavor compared to their American counterparts. Shows us a stunning fermentation technique and quite intriguing for this reason.
This valuable and powerful beer is easily drink on a hot summer day, but that our home should be very close to our legs due to the high alcohol content.
Body and medium carbonation and maximum complexity. A beer that bow to the excellence!

With a cloudy golden yellow color that help cover sediments that fall to the bottom of the cup. This beautiful Strong Golden Ale features a White Cream of high training and dense with a lasting persistence that goes to the end of the tasting, marking harmoniously side of the cup.
Its aroma is delicious and exudes a metal flavor that probably originated from waste fell from re-fermentation. Very herbal and floral (white flowers). Being well with delicious fruity citrus notes of orange peel and spices such as coriander, ginger.
The taste is initially sweet, where the caramel hides behind the alcohol, and is soon caught by the ideal of bitterness Belgian herbal hops that merges with the spicy played that is present until the end of the sip. This beer strives for balance and to be refreshing.
Prolonged and bitter aftertaste of specific Belgian hops with a certain metallic taste.
The body is medium dry and spicy finish.
Drinkability medium / high.
A classic Strong Golden Ale Belgium

A dark red color with a beige cream, good training and medium to high duration.
The aroma is of espresso, roasted malt, nuts, cloves, bitter chocolate and some fruity denoting a certain sweetness.
Clove flavor at the beginning leaves a very pleasant feeling, which then immediately shows the caramel, good strong coffee being hugged by chocolate bitterness. The sweetness of fruity is revealed with shades of plum and very, very light banana flavor. Admittedly, the black bread is present in this explosion of flavors, syrups, and as the malty. In this way the alcohol emerges without compromising the set.
Silky texture, oily, shown with a bitter sweet touch that persists in the aftertaste.
A good amount of bitterness faithful to the style, great Doppelbock.
A great beer and maintained tradition.

A gorgeous very dark brown color, opaque and almost black as a moonless night.
A beige, dense and moderately persistent cream color with medium to high formation of an excellent lacing.
The aroma is intense coffee, roasted malts and smoked and caramel, vanilla that is worth appreciated length.
The taste is strong espresso, roasted malt and dark chocolate touches. A more significant cookie like what should imply gives an initial sweetness that unfolds into a proportional bitterness to lightly smoked touch and closing a delicious bitterness characteristic style. It shows a balanced drink Corps and low average carbonation, but does not compromise the set. A classic dryness is present at each end of sip.
The aftertaste shows up bitter, crisp and very pleasant.
A beautiful set and great drinkability!

Coloring Yellow straw and pale and blurred. Average foaming median retention in tumbler edges.
The Aroma shown citric notes with coriander, lemon, and moderate sweetness, a wheat background and cloves. A very low Hop, however the balance between aroma, flavor and alcohol in this Witbier is commendable.
Has a balanced flavor between the coriander, cloves, wheat, lemon, very light orange, closing with a slight bitterness in a slightly sweet finish. The texture shown a little sticky, but without leaving any residue on the palate making it a light and refreshing beer.
The palate has a medium body down with a medium carbonation. Surge light tartaric notes, but without astringency.
A sensational drinkability!

The hand of Pilsners is a wonderful beer.
Strong golden color with a white and effervescent foam good training.
The aroma reveals a strong herbal trend with lemongrass notes, cereals, cereal malt, honey, spicy hops, and why not some cookie nuances that bring a certain sweetness.
The taste is peculiar of this classic beer with apparent grains, cereals, honey, lemon grass, corn bread and spices logically all very well hopped a delicious bitterness. The malts are rather complex and merge in an interesting mixture with hop bitterness. A gem.
In a medium body and good carbonation in effervescent granules, dry finish say that brings a creamy texture and crisp closing a thin bitter that always, always ask another sip. Saaz hops blessed !!!
For me the best of all Lager. Incomparable.

Ruby intense staining the opaque red cherry.
The foam is high pinkish hue with good length and well aerated with micro bubbles. The foam mark the sides of the tulip.
This beautiful beer pronounced in the aroma of raspberry that integrates harmoniously.
The taste is an explosion of raspberries in a velvety feel. We can notice a pleasant bitterness characteristic of acid red fruit with a citrus sure inserted stressing the palate.
Excellent beer Fruitbeer style whose main characteristic balance between the sweetness of citrus fruits and this acidity.
A spectacular drinkability that for those hot days is a lost much, much better than soft drinks.

Shows the staining of copper bronze tones with a classic red Flemish such as Rodenbach. A head of pale cream foam, creamy, sticky, good stability and burgundy dim and hazy color.
Aroma is pleasant despite the strong aroma of apple cider vinegar and balsamic. Surge bread, some beans, caramel, passion fruit, apple, honey, vanilla, brown sugar, wood notes, dried fruit.
Medium body and medium to high carbonation.
In taste brings a sparkling vivacity in a battle, the sweetness of sugar, honey like it was almost a sweet and fierce relentless acidity of vinegar creating a sour grape dryness with wood tannins in the background to give a distinctive finish. This battle between the sweet and the sour closes harmoniously despite the sweetness be slightly higher.
We can note nuts, caramel, brown sugar, red wine, raisins, wood, balsamic notes to exemplify.
The finish is long, sour and fruity, very good drinkability.
Overall I found the wonderful and very authentic beer. A traditional example of Bruin oud style.

Pour the tulip a clear body of coppery red and white foam in pink tones of short duration.

Negative I can say that I did not like the average sour arising and very last wood.
Its really quite nice, although a little sweet for my taste.

By pouring in tulip enchants with an amber tint medium and opaque shade emerging a white and foamy cream.
The aroma is a fascinating and distinctive herbal hops, where I noticed passion fruit notes, pine, orange, an aroma sweetened by the malt.

With an intense and crystal-gold color. The foam is creamy and high white. Very good training and stay in the tulip. A beautiful presentation.

Amber color dark with a white foaming and high that lasts for a short time in your beautiful Shaker cup.
In its aroma there this malt, caramel, a delicious aroma of wet grass give a refreshing touch.
The taste clearly there is the presence of caramel malt and hops that refers to a herbaceous with soft bitterness. Very pleasant to drink.
Its aftertaste is dry and again the slight feeling of bitterness is present, but there is at its bottom the sweet malt and a touch of bread. This persists bitterness in the mouth and brings a smoked light after a while. Very interesting.

A golden red color (copper) and cloudy with a white foam, consistent and average volume.
A sweet aroma of malt, wood, fruit being identified for me the pear, peach, apricots, a pleasant aroma of caramel, and of course the Bourbon.
Moderately sweet taste in exact proportion, with delicious hints of malt, fruit, caramel, a beautiful Bourbon, oak and spices, and the hop bitterness is present. Woody end. Creamy texture and a bit oily.
 Full-bodied with a low, soft carbonation, making it soft and very easy to drink.
Very nice it, but beware of its 10% alcohol content that is very well hidden, so to speak.

A classic Belgian beer seasonal! A label that reminds Christmas and Santa Claus!
Reddish copper color, with a beige cream voluminous, compact and solid.
A delicious aroma emerges, being well fruity with strong presence of red fruits, and malt rises as well, gently toasted caramel hops providing a special touch in a well integrated carbonation in the set. Condiments bring a special and soft touch and the medium / low bitterness is underscored by the spices. It also appears, a citrus and floral perhaps simple touch.
At first sip I felt a consistent carbonation that great body, and there stands the caramel a balanced combination where the flavor is balanced with the malt, hops and fruit in the exact measure.
At no time this beer proved cloying and heavy although we are in full in December, spring / summer of the tropics. A master worthy recipe this drink.
The end has a long, discreet closing, tasteful, without excesses leaving a soft taste and a malt that balances the senses remaining in the aftertaste. Alcohol shown is noticeable despite its 9%!
Fantastic!
